thread.title: Winter storm warning issued for Sierra and Lake Tahoe regions, chain controls in effect
thread.title_full: Winter storm warning issued for Sierra and Lake Tahoe regions, chain controls in effect

author: News 4 & Fox 11 Digital Staff
title: Winter storm warning issued for Sierra and Lake Tahoe regions, chain controls in effect
text: {p}{ }Flag for usage of AI Transcript Assistant{/p}{p}A winter storm warning is in effect from 1 p.m. Friday through 10 p.m. Saturday for the Sierra and Greater Lake Tahoe regions. {/p}{p}The Sierra is expected to receive up to 3 feet of snow along the highest elevations, with Sierra communities likely to see 4 to 8 inches. The majority of the snowfall is anticipated on Saturday.{/p}{p}In the Greater Lake Tahoe region, forecasts predict 4 to 10 inches of heavy, wet snow, with 8 to 20 inches expected above 6,500 feet. Winds are projected to gust up to 45 mph in the valleys and reach 120 mph over the ridges. Lake Tahoe may experience waves between 2 to 4 feet.{/p}{p}{sd-embed class=\"sd-embedded-media\" data-embed-file=\"%3Ciframe%20src=%22https://www.facebook.com/plugins/post.php?href=https%253A%252F%252Fwww.facebook.com%252FNWSReno%252Fposts%252Fpfbid028d1gM6oojmGHstax1JFkAGnrqEn1Azte4iUYnpe26F2qHwy6eedz9pv2w8gmoCErl&show_text=true&width=500%22%20width=%22500%22%20height=%22250%22%20style=%22border:none;overflow:hidden%22%20scrolling=%22no%22%20frameborder=%220%22%20allowfullscreen=%22true%22%20allow=%22autoplay;%20clipboard-write;%20encrypted-media;%20picture-in-picture;%20web-share%22%3E%3C/iframe%3E\" data-embed-type=\"facebook\" contenteditable=\"false\"}{/sd-embed}{/p}{p}Authorities urge residents and travelers to heed any and all travel restrictions during this period.{/p}{p}As of Friday morning, chain controls are in effect on the following Sierra passes: {/p}{ul}{li}I-80 in both directions from Hirschdale Road to Baxter{/li}{li}SR-267 in both directions from Truckee to Kings Beach{/li}{li}SR-89 in both directions from Picketts Junction to Luther Pass{/li}{/ul}{p}Follow our latest Weather Authority forecast {a href=\"https://mynews4.com/weather\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://mynews4.com/weather\"}here.{/a}{/p}{p}{br}{/p}{p}{br}{/p}{h2}{a href=\"https://mynews4.com/weather\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://mynews4.com/weather\"}{strong}News 4 10-day Forecast{ }{/strong}{/a}{strong}| {/strong}{a href=\"https://mynews4.com/weather/radar\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://mynews4.com/weather/radar\"}Interactive Radar{/a}{strong} | {/strong}{a href=\"https://mynews4.com/weather/skycam\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://mynews4.com/weather/skycam\"}Sky Cams{/a}{/h2}{h2}FRIDAY DECEMBER 13, 2024{/h2}{p}{strong}GREATER RE{/strong}{strong}NO-CARSON CITY{br}{br}WEATHER ADVISORIES:{br}{br}WIND ADVISORY: {/strong}In effect from 10 pm until Saturday 4 pm for strong winds that could blow over unsecured objects.{ }{/p}{p}{strong}TODAY{/strong}:{br}Partly Sunny, 20% Chance of Light Early Morning Rain/Snow Showers, Little to no accumulation{ }{br}{strong}HIGHS{/strong}: 46-48{br}{strong}WINDS{/strong}: Southwest 5 to 10 mph{ }{br}{/p}{p}{strong}TONIGHT{/strong}:{br}Mostly Cloudy, 40% Afternoon Rain Showers, Breezy{br}{strong}LOWS{/strong}: 33-34{br}{strong}WINDS{/strong}: South 15 to 25 mph, Gusting to 40 mph{ }{br}{/p}{p}{strong}SATURDAY{/strong}:{br}Mostly Cloudy, 80% Chance of Rain, Windy{br}{strong}HIGHS{/strong}: 46-48{br}{strong}WINDS{/strong}: Southwest 30 to 35 mph, Gusting to 60 mph{br}{/p}{p}{strong}SUNDAY{/strong}:{br}Sunny{ }{br}{strong}HIGHS{/strong}: 41-43{br}{strong}WINDS{/strong}: Calm{ }{/p}{p}The next storm is taking aim at the region, and will start moving in today.{ } Reno will see light rain showers this afternoon.{ } Rain and snow showers will visit Lake Tahoe, with little to no accumulation.{ } Accumulating snow is expected on Donner Pass.{ } Most of the moisture moves through on Saturday.{ } Heavy snow is expected over Donner Pass, with several inches of snow possible around Lake Tahoe.{ } Winter Storm Warnings have been issued for the Sierra through Saturday night.{ } Reno and the valleys will see very strong winds and light rain throughout Saturday.{ } { }Be sure to stay with News4 for the latest information, both on-air and online.{/p}{p}{strong}GREATER LAKE TAHOE AREA{br}{br}WEATHER ALERTS:{ }{ }{/strong}.{/p}{p}{strong}WINTER STORM WARNING:{ }{/strong}{ }In effect 1 pm{ } Friday through 10 pm Saturday night.{ } Snow showers are possible on Friday, with accumulating snow likely on Saturday.{ } Latest model runs indicate 4 to 6 inches of snow around lake level in Tahoe.{ } Potentially 12 to 18 inches of snow over Sierra passes.{ } Travel will be very difficult in the Sierra through Saturday.{ }{ }{/p}{p}{strong}TODAY:{br}{/strong}Mostly Cloudy, 80% Chance of Snow Showers, Total daytime snow accumulation of less than a half inch possible{br}{strong}HIGHS{/strong}: 37-39{br}{strong}WINDS{/strong}: South 5 mph{br}{/p}{p}{strong}TONIGHT{/strong}:{br}Mostly Cloudy, 80% Chance of rain and Snow, Breezy{br}{strong}LOWS{/strong}: 23-25{br}{strong}WINDS{/strong}: South 10 to 20 mph, Gusting to 30 mph{br}{/p}{p}{strong}SATURDAY{/strong}:{br}100% Chance of Snow, New snow accumulation of 3 to 7 inches possible, Windy{br}{strong}HIGHS{/strong}: 42-44{br}{strong}WINDS{/strong}: Southwest 15 to 25 mph, Gusting to 40 mph{br}{/p}{p}{strong}SUNDAY{/strong}:{br}Sunny, Chilly{br}{strong}HIGHS{/strong}: 42-44{br}WINDS: Calm{/p}{p}{strong}----{/strong}{strong}-{/strong}{strong} {/strong}{/p}{h2}WEATHER AUTHORITY TEAM{/h2}{p}{strong}Chief Meteorologist Matt Monroe:{
